title: Sound of Sorry // Erik & Susie
description:
See how it all turns out when an old schoolmate tries to make peace with the woman he wronged in high school.
#ItTakesCourage

asset.title: Sound of Sorry // Erik & Susie
asset.description: See how it all turns out when an old schoolmate tries to make peace with the woman he wronged in high school // Discover more @ http://neverhi.de/7bln // #ItTakesCourage
asset.author: Ray-Ban Films

transcripts: It was a mixture of lack of judgement, peer pressure, and trying to fit in. Unfortunately, I tarnished someone else's reputation in doing so. There was one occasion where my friends whose house we were going to asked me to go up to his room to grab a CD or something, so I went up to his room and started looking through some things trying to find the exact CD we were looking for. Then I found myself following Susie upstairs, we were alone for a brief period of time, and nothing sexual whatsoever happened. I remember walking down and there were a ton of people in there, and they immediately did the classic staring at me, whispering, laughing, and I didn't know what had happened. Driving home he started probing me, asking me "what happened," what happened, what happened?  I sort of agreed to a few things that didn't happen. Very quickly after, I remember having that classic mean girl scenario going to the lunchroom one day and the big group of girlfriends that I would sit with getting up, and clearing  and laughing and coming to my face and cursing me out and I remember not having any clue what happened. I kind of gave birth to this untrue story and for the rest of high school, I kind of kept going with it. I think at that age, when a rumor is created it's my impression that there's not really any effort by kids to seek the truth of the matter. I was approached once by Susie, I'm not sure exactly when sometime during school  and she asked me to kind of come clean and I said "No." And that was a rumor that persisted until graduation form high school. Up until about a year to two years ago I came to a bit of a crossroads in my own life where I felt that I needed to be a man of integrity. You know obviously I can't change the past, but you can always change going forward. Then I say down one day and I wrote down like my life goals, and one of those goals is to live regret free. Awesome. And the one thing I regretted was that unfortunate incident that occurred between you and I. A lot of who we become as adults and all of the wonderful things we do wouldn't be possible without those negative experiences or hard times. Sure, yeah you've got to- you know, so in an odd way maybe- You could have honestly said "FU, I hate you, don't ever contact me again." No, my goodness! No it meant the world that it validated so many things, I think. It did take a lot of courage, I will admit it was one of the harder things I've done. I think It's most important to be a solid character despite what situation, but so long as you just always act with dignity and grace, like a proper, conscientious person, I  think that's what courage should be.
